intro: Erigeron rottleri, commonly known as the Rottler's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, such as rocky soils and open woodlands. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Erigeron rottleri is often found in disturbed habitats and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions.
